result.execSummary:
The defendant James P Siudzinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 3/25/15.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James P Siudzinski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant James P Siudzinski in court PRO SE.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is somewhat compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant James P Siudzinski in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 7 months in the House of Correction with credit for 15 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 15 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 3/25/15.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant James P Siudzinski in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  Court is in trial and cannot hear the matter.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant James P Siudzinski in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated July 31, 2015 received and filed.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.

Defendant James P Siudzinski in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled to address violation report.
Court admonishes defendant but does not amend bail at this time.  Case remains scheduled for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 40.
Clerk:  jms
Final pre-trial scheduled for 09-29-2015 at 08:30 a.m.  Jury trial scheduled for 10-21-2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant James P Siudzinski in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for trial.  State's motion to join cases for purposes of trial; no objection by defense counsel.
Court orders cases joined for trial and case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 40.  Court advises defendant to comply with monitoring and that all conditions of bail remain as previously set including the No Contact Order.
Clerk:  jms
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RMS dob 4/13/81

Defendant James P Siudzinski in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant James P Siudzinski in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
